Articles.Content:
I came relatively late to KSP1 (first played in 2019) and it created one of the best gaming memories for me and completely boosted my interest in astrophysics and just science in general.

I remember my fist rendezvous on the game rescuing my last scientist in my career mode which was a crazzyyy experience, super fun i even made a little post about it 

 

Now KSP2 is coming out and its gonna be great to create new memories especially with the coming multiplayer feature and getting to create memories with friends. I haven't played KSP1 in a while so it's going to be nice remembering how things works again. 

What were your most memorable moments in KSP?

Edited February 19, 2023 by IU_R

It'd probably be my first docking too. I remember seeing the little speck for the first time, zeroing out relative velocity, then slowly flying up to the target ship. It felt so real and like something you'd totally see on a NASA livestream.
Well, there was my first intact Mun landing.
